t: Jeremiah 1
The*p words of Jeremiah the son of Hilkiah, of the priests who were*i in Anathoth in the land of Benjamin,
to whom the word of the Lord*s came in the days of Josiah the son of Amon, king of Judah, in the thirteenth year of his reign.

It came also in the days of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, king of Judah, until the end of the eleventh year of Zedekiah the son of Josiah, king of Judah, until the carrying away of Jerusalem captive in the fifth month.
The Prophet Is Called
Then*p the word of the Lord*s came to me, saying:
“Before*pn I formed you in the womb I knew you; Before*ld you were born I sanctified you; I*ld ordained you a prophet to the nations.”
Then*p said I: “Ah,*pn Lord God!*s Behold,*ld I cannot speak, for I am*i a youth.”
But*p the Lord*s said to me: “Do*pn not say, ‘I am*i a youth,’ For*ld you shall go to all to whom I send you, And*ld whatever I command you, you shall speak.
Do*ld not be afraid of their faces, For*ld I am*i with you to deliver you,” says the Lord.*s
Then*p the Lord*s put forth His hand and touched my mouth, and the Lord*s said to me: “Behold,*pn I have put My words in your mouth.
See,*ld I have this day set you over the nations and over the kingdoms, To*ld root out and to pull down, To*ld destroy and to throw down, To*ld build and to plant.”
Moreover*p the word of the Lord*s came to me, saying, “Jeremiah, what do you see?” And*p I said, “I see a branch of an almond tree.”
Then*p the Lord*s said to me, “You have seen well, for I am ready to perform My word.”
And*p the word of the Lord*s came to me the second time, saying, “What do you see?” And*p I said, “I see a boiling pot, and it is facing away from the north.”
Then*p the Lord*s said to me: “Out*pn of the north calamity shall break forth On*ld all the inhabitants of the land.

For*ld behold, I am calling All*ld the families of the kingdoms of the north,” says the Lord;*s “They*ld shall come and each one set his throne At*ld the entrance of the gates of Jerusalem, Against*ld all its walls all around, And*ld against all the cities of Judah.
I*ld will utter My judgments Against*ld them concerning all their wickedness, Because*ld they have forsaken Me, Burned*ld incense to other gods, And*ld worshiped the works of their own hands.
“Therefore*ln prepare yourself and arise, And*ld speak to them all that I command you. Do*ld not be dismayed before their faces, Lest*ld I dismay you before them.

For*ld behold, I have made you this day A*ld fortified city and an iron pillar, And*ld bronze walls against the whole land— Against*ld the kings of Judah, Against*ld its princes, Against*ld its priests, And*ld against the people of the land.
They*ld will fight against you, But*ld they shall not prevail against you. For*ld I am*i with you,” says the Lord,*s “to deliver you.”
Jeremiah 2
God’s Case Against Israel
Moreover*p the word of the Lord*s came to me, saying,

“Go*pn and cry in the hearing of Jerusalem, saying, ‘Thus says the Lord:*s “I*ld remember you, The*ld kindness of your youth, The*ld love of your betrothal, When*ld you went after Me in the wilderness, In*ld a land not sown.
Israel*ld was*i holiness to the Lord,*s The*ld firstfruits of His increase. All*ld that devour him will offend; Disaster*ld will come upon them,” says the Lord.’”*s
Hear*p the word of the Lord,*s O house of Jacob and all the families of the house of Israel.
Thus says the Lord:*s “What*pn injustice have your fathers found in Me, That*ld they have gone far from Me, Have*ld followed idols, And*ld have become idolaters?

Neither*ld did they say, ‘Where is*i the Lord,*s Who*ld brought us up out of the land of Egypt, Who*ld led us through the wilderness, Through*ld a land of deserts and pits, Through*ld a land of drought and the shadow of death, Through*ld a land that no one crossed And*ld where no one dwelt?’

The*ld priests did not say, ‘Where is*i the Lord?’*s And*ld those who handle the law did not know Me; The*ld rulers also transgressed against Me; The*ld prophets prophesied by Baal, And*ld walked after things*i that*i do not profit.
“Therefore*ln I will yet bring charges against you,” says the Lord,*s “And*ld against your children’s children I will bring charges.
For*ld pass beyond the coasts of Cyprus and see, Send*ld to Kedar and consider diligently, And*ld see if there has been such a*i thing.
Has*ld a nation changed its*i gods, Which*ld are*i not gods? But*ld My people have changed their Glory For*ld what*i does not profit.
Be*ld astonished, O heavens, at this, And*ld be horribly afraid; Be*ld very desolate,” says the Lord.*s
“For*ld My people have committed two evils: They*ld have forsaken Me, the fountain of living waters, And*ild hewn themselves cisterns—broken cisterns that can hold no water.
“Is*iln Israel a servant? Is*ild he a homeborn slave?*i Why*ld is he plundered?
The*ld young lions roared at him, and*i growled; They*ld made his land waste; His*ld cities are burned, without inhabitant.
Also*ld the people of Noph and Tahpanhes Have*ld broken the crown of your head.
Have*ld you not brought this on yourself, In*ld that you have forsaken the Lord*s your God When*ld He led you in the way?

Your*ld own wickedness will correct you, And*ld your backslidings will rebuke you. Know*ld therefore and see that it*i is*i an evil and bitter thing*i That*ld you have forsaken the Lord*s your God, And*ld the fear of Me is*i not in you,” Says*ld the Lord God*s of hosts.
“For*ln of old I have broken your yoke and*i burst your bonds; And*ld you said, ‘I will not transgress,’ When*ld on every high hill and under every green tree You*ld lay down, playing the harlot.
Yet*ld I had planted you a noble vine, a seed of highest quality. How*ld then have you turned before Me Into*ld the degenerate plant of an alien vine?
For*ld though you wash yourself with lye, and use much soap, Yet*ild your iniquity is marked before Me,” says the Lord God.*s
“How*ln can you say, ‘I am not polluted, I*ld have not gone after the Baals’? See*ld your way in the valley; Know*ld what you have done: You*ild are*i a swift dromedary breaking loose in her ways,

A*ld wild donkey used to the wilderness, That*ild sniffs at the wind in her desire; In*ld her time of mating, who can turn her away? All*ld those who seek her will not weary themselves; In*ld her month they will find her.
Withhold*ld your foot from being unshod, and your throat from thirst. But*ld you said, ‘There is no hope. No!*ld For I have loved aliens, and after them I will go.’
“As*ln the thief is ashamed when he is found out, So*ld is the house of Israel ashamed; They*ld and their kings and their princes, and their priests and their prophets,

Saying*ld to a tree, ‘You are*i my father,’ And*ld to a stone, ‘You gave birth to me.’ For*ld they have turned their*i back to Me, and not their*i face. But*ld in the time of their trouble They*ld will say, ‘Arise and save us.’

But*ld where are*i your gods that you have made for yourselves? Let*ld them arise, If*ld they can save you in the time of your trouble; For*ld according*i to*i the number of your cities Are*ld your gods, O Judah.
“Why*ln will you plead with Me? You*ld all have transgressed against Me,” says the Lord.*s
“In*ld vain I have chastened your children; They*ld received no correction. Your*ld sword has devoured your prophets Like*ld a destroying lion.
“O*ln generation, see the word of the Lord!*s Have*ld I been a wilderness to Israel, Or*ld a land of darkness? Why*ld do My people say, ‘We are lords; We*ld will come no more to You’?
Can*ld a virgin forget her ornaments, Or*ild a bride her attire? Yet*ld My people have forgotten Me days without number.
“Why*ln do you beautify your way to seek love? Therefore*ld you have also taught The*ld wicked women your ways.
Also*ld on your skirts is found The*ld blood of the lives of the poor innocents. I*ld have not found it by secret search, But*ld plainly on all these things.
Yet*ld you say, ‘Because I am innocent, Surely*ld His anger shall turn from me.’ Behold,*ld I will plead My case against you, Because*ld you say, ‘I have not sinned.’
Why*ld do you gad about so much to change your way? Also*ld you shall be ashamed of Egypt as you were ashamed of Assyria.
Indeed*ld you will go forth from him With*ld your hands on your head; For*ld the Lord*s has rejected your trusted allies, And*ld you will not prosper by them.
Jeremiah 3
Israel Is Shameless

“They*pn say, ‘If a man divorces his wife, And*ld she goes from him And*ld becomes another man’s, May*ld he return to her again?’ Would*ld not that land be greatly polluted? But*ld you have played the harlot with many lovers; Yet*ld return to Me,” says the Lord.*s

“Lift*ln up your eyes to the desolate heights and see: Where*ld have you not lain with*i men?*i By*ld the road you have sat for them Like*ld an Arabian in the wilderness; And*ld you have polluted the land With*ld your harlotries and your wickedness.
Therefore*ld the showers have been withheld, And*ld there has been no latter rain. You*ld have had a harlot’s forehead; You*ld refuse to be ashamed.
Will*ld you not from this time cry to Me, ‘My*ld Father, You are*i the guide of my youth?
Will*ld He remain angry forever? Will*ld He keep it to the end?’ Behold,*ld you have spoken and done evil things, As*ld you were able.”
A Call to Repentance

The*p Lord*s said also to me in the days of Josiah the king: “Have you seen what backsliding Israel has done? She has gone up on every high mountain and under every green tree, and there played the harlot.
And I said, after she had done all these things,*i ‘Return to Me.’ But she did not return. And her treacherous sister Judah saw it.

Then I saw that for all the causes for which backsliding Israel had committed adultery, I had put her away and given her a certificate of divorce; yet her treacherous sister Judah did not fear, but went and played the harlot also.
So it came to pass, through her casual harlotry, that she defiled the land and committed adultery with stones and trees.
And yet for all this her treacherous sister Judah has not turned to Me with her whole heart, but in pretense,” says the Lord.*s
Then*p the Lord*s said to me, “Backsliding Israel has shown herself more righteous than treacherous Judah.

Go and proclaim these words toward the north, and say: ‘Return,*pn backsliding Israel,’ says the Lord;*s ‘I*ld will not cause My anger to fall on you. For*ld I am*i merciful,’ says the Lord;*s ‘I*ld will not remain angry forever.

Only*ld acknowledge your iniquity, That*ld you have transgressed against the Lord*s your God, And*ld have scattered your charms To*ld alien deities under every green tree, And*ld you have not obeyed My voice,’ says the Lord.*s
“Return,*p O backsliding children,” says the Lord;*s “for I am married to you. I will take you, one from a city and two from a family, and I will bring you to Zion.
And I will give you shepherds according to My heart, who will feed you with knowledge and understanding.

“Then*p it shall come to pass, when you are multiplied and increased in the land in those days,” says the Lord,*s “that they will say no more, ‘The ark of the covenant of the Lord.’*s It shall not come to mind, nor shall they remember it, nor shall they visit it,*i nor shall it be made anymore.

“At*p that time Jerusalem shall be called The Throne of the Lord,*s and all the nations shall be gathered to it, to the name of the Lord,*s to Jerusalem. No more shall they follow the dictates of their evil hearts.
“In*p those days the house of Judah shall walk with the house of Israel, and they shall come together out of the land of the north to the land that I have given as an inheritance to your fathers.

“But*p I said: ‘How*pn can I put you among the children And*ld give you a pleasant land, A*ld beautiful heritage of the hosts of nations?’ “And*p I said: ‘You*pn shall call Me, “My Father,” And*ld not turn away from Me.’
Surely,*ld as*i a wife treacherously departs from her husband, So*ld have you dealt treacherously with Me, O*ld house of Israel,” says the Lord.*s
A*ln voice was heard on the desolate heights, Weeping*ld and*i supplications of the children of Israel. For*ld they have perverted their way; They*ld have forgotten the Lord*s their God.
“Return,*ln you backsliding children, And*ild I will heal your backslidings.” “Indeed*ln we do come to You, For*ld You are the Lord*s our God.
Truly,*ld in vain is*i salvation*i hoped*i for*i from the hills, And*ild from*i the multitude of mountains; Truly,*ld in the Lord*s our God Is*ild the salvation of Israel.

We*ld lie down in our shame, And*ld our reproach covers us. For*ld we have sinned against the Lord*s our God, We*ld and our fathers, From*ld our youth even to this day, And*ld have not obeyed the voice of the Lord*s our God.”
Jeremiah 4
“If*pn you will return, O Israel,” says the Lord,*s “Return*ld to Me; And*ld if you will put away your abominations out of My sight, Then*ld you shall not be moved.
And*ld you shall swear, ‘The Lord*s lives,’ In*ld truth, in judgment, and in righteousness; The*ld nations shall bless themselves in Him, And*ld in Him they shall glory.”
For*p thus says the Lord*s to the men of Judah and Jerusalem: “Break*pn up your fallow ground, And*ld do not sow among thorns.

Circumcise*ld yourselves to the Lord,*s And*ld take away the foreskins of your hearts, You*ld men of Judah and inhabitants of Jerusalem, Lest*ld My fury come forth like fire, And*ld burn so that no one can quench it,*i Because*ld of the evil of your doings.”
An Imminent Invasion
Declare*p in Judah and proclaim in Jerusalem, and say: “Blow*pn the trumpet in the land; Cry,*ld ‘Gather together,’ And*ld say, ‘Assemble yourselves, And*ld let us go into the fortified cities.’
Set*ld up the standard toward Zion. Take*ld refuge! Do not delay! For*ld I will bring disaster from the north, And*ld great destruction.”

The*ld lion has come up from his thicket, And*ld the destroyer of nations is on his way. He*ld has gone forth from his place To*ld make your land desolate. Your*ld cities will be laid waste, Without*ld inhabitant.
For*ld this, clothe yourself with sackcloth, Lament*ld and wail. For*ld the fierce anger of the Lord*s Has*ld not turned back from us.

“And*ln it shall come to pass in that day,” says the Lord,*s “That*ild the heart of the king shall perish, And*ld the heart of the princes; The*ld priests shall be astonished, And*ld the prophets shall wonder.”
Then*ln I said, “Ah, Lord God!*s Surely*ld You have greatly deceived this people and Jerusalem, Saying,*ld ‘You shall have peace,’ Whereas*ld the sword reaches to the heart.”

A*ld wind too strong for these will come for Me; Now*ld I will also speak judgment against them.”
“Behold,*ln he shall come up like clouds, And*ld his chariots like a whirlwind. His*ld horses are swifter than eagles. Woe*ld to us, for we are plundered!”
O*ln Jerusalem, wash your heart from wickedness, That*ld you may be saved. How*ld long shall your evil thoughts lodge within you?
For*ld a voice declares from Dan And*ld proclaims affliction from Mount Ephraim:
“Make*ld mention to the nations, Yes,*ld proclaim against Jerusalem, That*ild watchers come from a far country And*ld raise their voice against the cities of Judah.
Like*ld keepers of a field they are against her all around, Because*ld she has been rebellious against Me,” says the Lord.*s
“Your*ld ways and your doings Have*ld procured these things*i for you. This*ld is*i your wickedness, Because*ld it is bitter, Because*ld it reaches to your heart.”
Sorrow for the Doomed Nation

O*pn my soul, my soul! I*ld am pained in my very heart! My*ld heart makes a noise in me; I*ld cannot hold my peace, Because*ld you have heard, O my soul, The*ld sound of the trumpet, The*ld alarm of war.
Destruction*ld upon destruction is cried, For*ld the whole land is plundered. Suddenly*ld my tents are plundered, And*ild my curtains in a moment.
How*ld long will I see the standard, And*ild hear the sound of the trumpet?
“For*ln My people are*i foolish, They*ld have not known Me. They*ld are*i silly children, And*ld they have no understanding. They*ld are*i wise to do evil, But*ld to do good they have no knowledge.”
I*ln beheld the earth, and indeed it*i was*i without form, and void; And*ld the heavens, they had*i no light.

“And*ln when*i you are*i plundered, What*ld will you do? Though*ld you clothe yourself with crimson, Though*ld you adorn yourself*i with ornaments of gold, Though*ld you enlarge your eyes with paint, In*ld vain you will make yourself fair; Your*ild lovers will despise you; They*ld will seek your life.

“For*ln I have heard a voice as of a woman in labor, The*ld anguish as of her who brings forth her first child, The*ld voice of the daughter of Zion bewailing herself; She*ld spreads her hands, saying,*i ‘Woe*ld is*i me now, for my soul is weary Because*ld of murderers!’
Jeremiah 5
The Justice of God’s Judgment

“Run*pn to and fro through the streets of Jerusalem; See*ld now and know; And*ld seek in her open places If*ld you can find a man, If*ld there is anyone*i who executes judgment, Who*ld seeks the truth, And*ld I will pardon her.

O*ln Lord,*s are*i not Your eyes on the truth? You*ld have stricken them, But*ld they have not grieved; You*ld have consumed them, But*ld they have refused to receive correction. They*ld have made their faces harder than rock; They*ld have refused to return.

I*ld will go to the great men and speak to them, For*ld they have known the way of the Lord,*s The*ld judgment of their God.” But*ln these have altogether broken the yoke And*ild burst the bonds.

Therefore*ld a lion from the forest shall slay them, A*ld wolf of the deserts shall destroy them; A*ld leopard will watch over their cities. Everyone*ld who goes out from there shall be torn in pieces, Because*ld their transgressions are many; Their*ld backslidings have increased.

“How*ln shall I pardon you for this? Your*ld children have forsaken Me And*ld sworn by those*i that are not gods. When*ld I had fed them to the full, Then*ld they committed adultery And*ld assembled themselves by troops in the harlots’ houses.

“Go*ln up on her walls and destroy, But*ld do not make a complete end. Take*ld away her branches, For*ld they are*i not the Lord*s ’s.
For*ld the house of Israel and the house of Judah Have*ld dealt very treacherously with Me,” says the Lord.*s
They*ln have lied about the Lord,*s And*ld said, “It*i is*i not He. Neither*ld will evil come upon us, Nor*ld shall we see sword or famine.
And*ld the prophets become wind, For*ld the word is*i not in them. Thus*ld shall it be done to them.”
Therefore*p thus says the Lord*s God of hosts: “Because*pn you speak this word, Behold,*ld I will make My words in your mouth fire, And*ld this people wood, And*ld it shall devour them.

Behold,*ld I will bring a nation against you from afar, O*ld house of Israel,” says the Lord.*s “It*ld is*i a mighty nation, It*ld is*i an ancient nation, A*ld nation whose language you do not know, Nor*ld can you understand what they say.

“Nevertheless*p in those days,” says the Lord,*s “I will not make a complete end of you.

And it will be when you say, ‘Why does the Lord*s our God do all these things*i to us?’ then you shall answer them, ‘Just as you have forsaken Me and served foreign gods in your land, so you shall serve aliens in a land that*i is*i not yours.’
“Declare*pn this in the house of Jacob And*ld proclaim it in Judah, saying,
‘Hear*ld this now, O foolish people, Without*ld understanding, Who*ld have eyes and see not, And*ld who have ears and hear not:

Your*ld iniquities have turned these things*i away, And*ld your sins have withheld good from you.

Shall*ld I not punish them*i for these things?’*i says the Lord.*s ‘Shall*ld I not avenge Myself on such a nation as this?’
“An*ln astonishing and horrible thing Has*ld been committed in the land:
The*ld prophets prophesy falsely, And*ld the priests rule by their own*i power; And*ld My people love to*i have*i it*i so. But*ld what will you do in the end?
Jeremiah 6
Impending Destruction from the North

“O*pn you children of Benjamin, Gather*ld yourselves to flee from the midst of Jerusalem! Blow*ld the trumpet in Tekoa, And*ld set up a signal-fire in Beth Haccerem; For*ld disaster appears out of the north, And*ld great destruction.

To*ln whom shall I speak and give warning, That*ld they may hear? Indeed*ld their ear is*i uncircumcised, And*ld they cannot give heed. Behold,*ld the word of the Lord*s is a reproach to them; They*ld have no delight in it.

Therefore*ld I am full of the fury of the Lord.*s I*ld am weary of holding it*i in. “I*ld will pour it out on the children outside, And*ld on the assembly of young men together; For*ld even the husband shall be taken with the wife, The*ld aged with him*i who*i is*i full of days.

Thus*p says the Lord:*s “Stand*pn in the ways and see, And*ld ask for the old paths, where the good way is,*i And*ld walk in it; Then*ld you will find rest for your souls. But*ld they said, ‘We will not walk in*i it.’*i

Thus*p says the Lord:*s “Behold,*pn a people comes from the north country, And*ld a great nation will be raised from the farthest parts of the earth.

We*ln have heard the report of it; Our*ld hands grow feeble. Anguish*ld has taken hold of us, Pain*ld as of a woman in labor.

“I*ln have set you as*i an assayer and*i a fortress among My people, That*ld you may know and test their way.
They*ld are*i all stubborn rebels, walking as slanderers. They*ild are*i bronze and iron, They*ld are*i all corrupters;
The*ld bellows blow fiercely, The*ld lead is consumed by the fire; The*ld smelter refines in vain, For*ld the wicked are not drawn off.
People*ild will call them rejected silver, Because*ld the Lord*s has rejected them.”

Jeremiah 35

“Therefore*p thus says the Lord*s God of hosts, the God of Israel: ‘Behold, I will bring on Judah and on all the inhabitants of Jerusalem all the doom that I have pronounced against them; because I have spoken to them but they have not heard, and I have called to them but they have not answered.’”
